intro: Comanthosphace ningpoensis var. stellipiloides, commonly known as the Ningpo stellipiloid liverwort, is a rare and specialized moss-like plant belonging to the family Comatulaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate leaves that are often clustered in dense, compact growths. This variant is typically found in moist, shaded environments, such as rocky crevices or damp soil in subtropical regions. Its morphology includes a distinctive arrangement of leaf cells and specialized reproductive structures. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
